intro: Tashiroea laisherana, commonly known as the Laisher's tashiroea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep purple. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Tashiroea laisherana is considered a vulnerable species.
